Submodules¶

carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.distance_engine module¶

class carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.distance_engine.Distance_Engine(parent: <module 'carlhauser_server.DatabaseAccessor.database_worker' from '/home/user/Desktop/douglas-quaid/carlhauser_server/DatabaseAccessor/database_worker.py'>, db_conf: carlhauser_server.Configuration.database_conf.Default_database_conf, dist_conf: carlhauser_server.Configuration.distance_engine_conf.Default_distance_engine_conf, fe_conf: carlhauser_server.Configuration.feature_extractor_conf.Default_feature_extractor_conf)[source]¶

Bases: object

Handle distance computation between pictures and their representations.

get_best_n_pictures_of_cluster(cluster_id)[source]¶
get_dist_and_decision_algos_to_algos(pic_package_from: Dict, pic_package_to: Dict) → Dict[str, carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.AlgoMatch][source]¶

Compute a list of distance and decision from two images representations, with activated (conf) algorithms. :param pic_package_from: dict of one image features :param pic_package_to: dict of one image features :return: merged dict of distance and decision for each algorithm

get_dist_and_decision_picture_to_picture(pic_package_from, pic_package_to) → [<class 'float'>, <enum 'DecisionTypes'>][source]¶

Compare two pictures by their features, to return a one unique distance and a one unique decision. All activated algorithms are involved. :param pic_package_from: dict of one image features :param pic_package_to: dict of one image features :return: distance and a decision

get_distance_picture_to_cluster(cluster_id: str, image_dict: Dict) → [<class 'float'>, <enum 'DecisionTypes'>][source]¶

Go through N first picture of given cluster, and test their distance to given image Merge the results into one unified distance :param cluster_id: the cluster id of the cluster to compare :param image_dict: the image dict of the picture to compare :return: a distance and a decision, from picture to the cluster

get_top_matching_clusters(cluster_list: List, image_dict: Dict) → List[carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.ClusterMatch][source]¶

Evaluate the similarity between the given picture and each cluster’s representative picture Returns a list of the N closest clusters :param cluster_list: The cluster list to iterate on, to check if the picture belongs to one of them :param image_dict: the picture features to use to check if belonging to each cluster :return: a top list of clusters with which the picture matches.

get_top_matching_pictures_from_clusters(cluster_list: List, image_dict: Dict) → List[carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.ImageMatch][source]¶

Evaluate the similarity between the given picture and all pictures of cluster list. Returns a list of the N closest pictures and cluster, with distance :param cluster_list: The cluster list to iterate on, to check if the picture is near one of its picture :param image_dict: the picture features to use to check if near any pictures of the cluster list :return: List of Imagematch, undifferenciated of their origin cluster

match_enough(matching_picture: carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.ImageMatch) → bool[source]¶

Check if a match is good enough. Compare the distance between pictures with the threshold between clsuters. Usable for storage graph. :param matching_picture: An ImageMatch object, which includes distance between pictures :return: boolean, True if pictures are close enough, False otherwise.

add_results(algo_conf: carlhauser_server.Configuration.algo_conf.Algo_conf, pic_package_from: Dict, pic_package_to: Dict, answer: Dict) → Dict[str, carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.AlgoMatch][source]¶

Add results to answer dict, depending on the algorithm name we want to compute Ex : Input {} -> Output {“P-HASH”:{“name”:”P-HASH”, “distance”:0.3,”decision”:YES}} :param algo_conf: An algorithm configuration (to specify which algorithm to launch) :param pic_package_from: first picture dict :param pic_package_to: second picture dict :param answer: Current dict of algo_name to algo match (will be updated and returned) :return: a dict of algo_name to algo match

static compute_decision_from_distance(algo_conf: carlhauser_server.Configuration.algo_conf.Algo_conf, dist: float) → carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.DecisionTypes[source]¶

From a distance between hashes, gives a decision : is it a match or not ? Or maybe ? :param algo_conf: An algorithm configuration (to specify which algorithm to launch) :param dist: distance between hashes :return: A decision : YES, MAYBE or NO

static compute_hash_distance(hash1, hash2) → float[source]¶

Compute hash difference for A-HASH, P-HASH, etc. :param hash1: first hash :param hash2: second hash :return: distance between hashes

static compute_tlsh_distance(hash1, hash2) → float[source]¶

Compute hash difference for TLSH only :param hash1: first hash :param hash2: second hash :return: distance between hashes

hash_distance(pic_package_from: Dict, pic_package_to: Dict) → Dict[str, carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.AlgoMatch][source]¶

Distance between two provided pictures (dicts) with fuzzy hashing methods :param pic_package_from: first picture dict :param pic_package_to: second picture dict :return: A dictionary of algo name to the match detail (distance, decision ..)

From a distance between orb distance, gives a decision : is it a match or not ? Or maybe ? # TODO : Evolve to more complex calculation if needed for ORB ! :param algo_conf: An algorithm configuration (to specify which algorithm to launch) :param dist: a distance between two pictures :return: a decision (YES,MAYBE,NO)

Utility function to compute the number of decision out of a list of decision. Can be weighted or not. :param matches_package: A dictionary from algorithm name to matches values (distance, decision ..) :param weighted: boolean to enable/disable the weight per algorithm type :return: a dict which map decision to number of occurrences of this decision

get_pareto_decision(matches_package: Dict[str, carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.AlgoMatch]) → carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.DecisionTypes[source]¶

Output a decision if more than 80% of the decision are the same. :param matches_package: A dictionary from algorithm name to matches values (distance, decision ..) :return: the computed decision

static get_prevalent_decision(decision_counter: Dict[carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.DecisionTypes, int]) → carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.DecisionTypes[source]¶

Utility function to get the most prevalent decision out of a list of decision :param decision_counter: a dict which map decision types to number of occurences. :return: the most prevalent decision (most numerous)

get_pyramid_decision(matches_package: Dict[str, carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.AlgoMatch]) → carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.DecisionTypes[source]¶

Output only one decision out of a list of decision. Start by most truthworthy algorithms. If unsure, go down in the algorithm trust hierarchy, until one algorithm is sure of its decision. :param matches_package: A dictionary from algorithm name to matches values (distance, decision ..) :return: the computed decision

get_weighted_majority_decision(matches_package: Dict[str, carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.AlgoMatch]) → carlhauser_server.DistanceEngine.scoring_datastrutures.DecisionTypes[source]¶

Output the most prevalent decision type, weighted by algorithm type :param matches_package: A dictionary from algorithm name to matches values (distance, decision ..) :return: the computed decision

Get the weighted per algorithm type mean of distances :param matches_package: A dictionary from algorithm name to matches values (distance, decision ..) :return: the computed distance
